name: Abomination
text: Whenever Abomination blocks or becomes blocked by a green or white creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

name: Air Elemental
text: Flying
flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

name: Alabaster Potion
text: Choose one —\n• Target player gains X life.\n• Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
flavor: "Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity."\n—D'Avenant proverb

name: Aladdin's Lamp
text: {X}, {T}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead look at the top X cards of your library, put all but one of them on the bottom of your library in a random order, then draw a card. X can't be 0.

name: Aladdin's Ring
text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: "After these words the magician drew a ring off his finger, and put it on one of Aladdin's, saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'" —The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.

name: Ali Baba
text: {R}: Tap target Wall.
flavor: "When he reached the entrance of the cavern, he pronounced the words, ‘Open, Sesame!'"\n—The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.

name: Amrou Kithkin
text: Amrou Kithkin can't be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater.
flavor: Quick and agile, Amrou Kithkin can usually escape from even the most fearsome opponents.

name: Amulet of Kroog
text: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
flavor: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing.

name: Angry Mob
text: Trample\nAs long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.

name: Animate Artifact
text: Enchant artifact\nAs long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

name: Animate Dead
text: Enchant creature card in a graveyard\nWhen Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.\nEnchanted creature gets -1/-0.

name: Animate Wall
text: Enchant Wall\nEnchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.

name: Ankh of Mishra
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

name: Apprentice Wizard
text: {U}, {T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.

name: Armageddon
text: Destroy all lands.

name: Armageddon Clock
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock.\nAt the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player.\n{4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

name: Ashes to Ashes
text: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.
flavor: "All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first."\n—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

name: Ashnod's Battle Gear
text: You may choose not to untap Ashnod's Battle Gear during your untap step.\n{2}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/-2 for as long as Ashnod's Battle Gear remains tapped.
flavor: This invention shows why Ashnod was feared by her troops as well as her foes.

name: Aspect of Wolf
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.

name: Backfire
text: Enchant creature\nWhenever enchanted creature deals damage to you, Backfire deals that much damage to that creature's controller.

name: Bad Moon
text: Black creatures get +1/+1.

name: Balance
text: Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

name: Ball Lightning
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nHaste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)\nAt the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

name: Battering Ram
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)\nWhenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.
flavor: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

name: Benalish Hero
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the Hero.

name: Bird Maiden
text: Flying
flavor:
Four things that never meet do here unite
To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

name: Birds of Paradise
text: Flying\n{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Black Knight
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)\nProtection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

name: Black Mana Battery
text: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Black Mana Battery.\n{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Black Mana Battery: Add {B} to your mana pool, then add an additional {B} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.

name: Black Vise
text: As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.\nAt the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.

name: Black Ward
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has protection from black. This effect doesn't remove Black Ward.

name: Blessing
text: Enchant creature\n{W}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Blight
text: Enchant land\nWhen enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

name: Blood Lust
text: If target creature has toughness 5 or greater, it gets +4/-4 until end of turn. Otherwise, it gets +4/-X until end of turn, where X is its toughness minus 1.

name: Blue Elemental Blast
text: Choose one —\n• Counter target red spell.\n• Destroy target red permanent.

name: Blue Mana Battery
text: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Blue Mana Battery.\n{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Blue Mana Battery: Add {U} to your mana pool, then add an additional {U} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.

name: Blue Ward
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has protection from blue. This effect doesn't remove Blue Ward.

name: Bog Imp
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.

name: Bog Wraith
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

name: Bottle of Suleiman
text: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

name: Brainwash
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.
flavor: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

name: Brass Man
text: Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.

name: Bronze Tablet
text: Remove Bronze Tablet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.\nBronze Tablet enters the battlefield tapped.\n{4}, {T}: Exile Bronze Tablet and target nontoken permanent an opponent owns. That player may pay 10 life. If he or she does, put Bronze Tablet into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player owns Bronze Tablet and you own the other exiled card.

name: Brothers of Fire
text: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
flavor: Fire is never a gentle master.

name: Burrowing
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has mountainwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

name: Carnivorous Plant
text: Defender
flavor: "It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."\n—Vervamon the Elder

name: Carrion Ants
text: {1}: Carrion Ants gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "War is no picnic," my father liked to say. But the Ants seemed to disagree.

name: Castle
text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.

name: Cave People
text: Whenever Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn.\n{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

name: Celestial Prism
text: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Channel
text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {C} to your mana pool.

name: Chaoslace
text: Target spell or permanent becomes red. (Its mana symbols remain unchanged.)

name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
text: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Black
text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Blue
text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Green
text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Red
text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: White
text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Clay Statue
text: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
flavor: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

name: Clockwork Avian
text:
Flying
Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Clockwork Beast
text: Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.\nAt end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.\n{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Cockatrice
text: Flying\nWhenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

name: Colossus of Sardia
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nColossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.\n{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
flavor: From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom:\nWarrior born from a rocky womb.

name: Conservator
text: {3}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

name: Control Magic
text: Enchant creature\nYou control enchanted creature.

name: Conversion
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.\nAll Mountains are Plains.

name: Coral Helm
text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Cosmic Horror
text: First strike\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Cosmic Horror unless you pay {3}{B}{B}{B}. If Cosmic Horror is destroyed this way, it deals 7 damage to you.
flavor: ". . . [S]creams of horror rend th' affrighted skies." —Alexander Pope, The Rape of the Lock

name: Counterspell
text: Counter target spell.

name: Craw Wurm
flavor: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

name: Creature Bond
text: Enchant creature\nWhen enchanted creature dies, Creature Bond deals damage equal to that creature's toughness to the creature's controller.

name: Crimson Manticore
text: Flying\n{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, Manticores can be fearsome allies.  As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.

name: Crumble
text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
flavor: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.

name: Crusade
text: White creatures get +1/+1.

name: Crystal Rod
text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Cursed Land
text: Enchant land\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Cursed Rack
text: As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.\nThe chosen player's maximum hand size is four.
flavor: Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.

name: Cyclopean Mummy
text: When Cyclopean Mummy dies, exile it.
flavor: The ritual of plucking out an eye to gain future sight is but a curse that enables the living to see their own deaths.

name: Dancing Scimitar
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

name: Dark Ritual
text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

name: Death Ward
text: Regenerate target creature.

name: Deathgrip
text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.

name: Deathlace
text: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

name: Desert Twister
text: Destroy target permanent.

name: Detonate
text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

name: Diabolic Machine
text: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.
flavor: "The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."\n—Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

name: Dingus Egg
text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

name: Disenchant
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

name: Disintegrate
text: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

name: Disrupting Scepter
text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

name: Divine Transformation
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +3/+3.
flavor: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.

name: Dragon Engine
text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

name: Dragon Whelp
text: Flying\n{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ." —Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"

name: Drain Life
text: Spend only black mana on X.\nDrain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.

name: Drain Power
text: Target player activates a mana ability of each land he or she controls. Then put all mana from that player's mana pool into yours.

name: Drudge Skeletons
text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

name: Durkwood Boars
flavor: "And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."\n—Mark 5:13

name: Dwarven Warriors
text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

name: Earth Elemental
flavor: Earth Elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

name: Earthquake
text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

name: Ebony Horse
text: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

name: El-Hajjâj
text: Whenever El-Hajjâj deals damage, you gain that much life.

name: Elder Land Wurm
text: Defender, trample\nWhen Elder Land Wurm blocks, it loses defender.
flavor: Sometimes it's best to let sleeping dragons lie.

name: Elven Riders
text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
flavor: "Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm."\n—Elven proverb

name: Elvish Archers
text: First strike
flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

name: Energy Flux
text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

name: Energy Tap
text: Tap target untapped creature you control. If you do, add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to that creature's converted mana cost.

name: Erg Raiders
text: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

name: Erosion
text: Enchant land\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, destroy that land unless that player pays {1} or 1 life.

name: Eternal Warrior
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has vigilance.
flavor: Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.

name: Evil Presence
text: Enchant land\nEnchanted land is a Swamp.

name: Eye for an Eye
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

name: Fear
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nEnchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

name: Feedback
text: Enchant enchantment\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Fellwar Stone
text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
flavor: "What do you have that I cannot obtain?"\n—Mairsil, called the Pretender

name: Fire Elemental
flavor: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

name: Fireball
text: Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.\nFireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

name: Firebreathing
text: Enchant creature\n{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "And topples round the dreary west\nA looming bastion fringed with fire."\n—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

name: Fissure
text: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: "Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?"\n—Plato

name: Flashfires
text: Destroy all Plains.

name: Flight
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has flying.

name: Flood
text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
flavor: "A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."\n—Vibekke Ragnild, Witches and War

name: Flying Carpet
text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

name: Fog
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

name: Force of Nature
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

name: Fortified Area
text: Wall creatures you control get +1/+0 and have banding. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

name: Frozen Shade
text: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "There are some qualities, some incorporate things, / That have a double life, which thus is made / A type of twin entity which springs / From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."\n—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

name: Fungusaur
text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

name: Gaea's Liege
text: As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.\n{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves the battlefield.

name: Gaseous Form
text: Enchant creature\nPrevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
flavor: ". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing\nA local habitation and a name."\n—William Shakespeare, A Midsummer-Night's Dream

name: Ghost Ship
text: Flying\n{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.
flavor: "That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below."\n—Mireille Gaetane, The Valeriad

name: Giant Growth
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Giant Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

name: Giant Strength
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2.
flavor:
"O! it is excellent
To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous
To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare, Measure for Measure

name: Giant Tortoise
text: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

name: Glasses of Urza
text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

name: Gloom
text: White spells cost {3} more to cast.\nActivated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!"\n"Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

name: Goblin King
text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

name: Goblin Rock Sled
text: Trample\nGoblin Rock Sled doesn't untap during your untap step if it attacked during your last turn.\nGoblin Rock Sled can't attack unless defending player controls a Mountain.

name: Grapeshot Catapult
text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor: Recent research suggests these creatures were invented by Urza's and Mishra's original master, Tocasia, and that both brothers used them.

name: Gray Ogre
flavor: The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, preferring to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

name: Greed
text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
flavor: "There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. . . . And there is no greater disaster than greed."\n—Tao Tê Ching 46

name: Green Mana Battery
text: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Green Mana Battery.\n{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Green Mana Battery: Add {G} to your mana pool, then add an additional {G} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.

name: Green Ward
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has protection from green. This effect doesn't remove Green Ward.

name: Grizzly Bears
flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

name: Healing Salve
text: Choose one —\n• Target player gains 3 life.\n• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

name: Helm of Chatzuk
text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

name: Hill Giant
flavor: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

name: Holy Armor
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +0/+2.\n{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

name: Holy Strength
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+2.

name: Howl from Beyond
text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

name: Howling Mine
text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

name: Hurkyl's Recall
text: Return all artifacts target player owns to his or her hand.
flavor: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife and former student, Hurkyl.

name: Hurloon Minotaur
flavor: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

name: Hurr Jackal
text: {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

name: Hurricane
text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

name: Hypnotic Specter
text: Flying\nWhenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
flavor: "...There was no trace\nOf aught on that illumined face...."\n—Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

name: Immolation
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/-2.

name: Inferno
text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: "Any scrap of compassion that still existed in my soul was permanently snuffed out when they cast me out into the flames."\n—Mairsil, called the Pretender

name: Instill Energy
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.\n{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

name: Iron Star
text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Ironclaw Orcs
text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

name: Ironroot Treefolk
flavor: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

name: Island Fish Jasconius
text:
Island Fish Jasconius doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, untap Island Fish Jasconius.
Island Fish Jasconius can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Island Fish Jasconius.

name: Island Sanctuary
text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

name: Ivory Cup
text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Ivory Tower
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus 4.
flavor: Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.

name: Jade Monolith
text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

name: Jandor's Saddlebags
text: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
flavor: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.

name: Jayemdae Tome
text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

name: Jump
text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

name: Junún Efreet
text: Flying\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.

name: Karma
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps he or she controls.

name: Keldon Warlord
text: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.

name: Killer Bees
text: Flying\n{G}: Killer Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.

name: Kismet
text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.

name: Kormus Bell
text: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.

name: Land Leeches
text: First strike
flavor: "The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech."\n—Vervamon the Elder

name: Land Tax
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Leviathan
text:
Trample
Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

name: Ley Druid
text: {T}: Untap target land.
flavor: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

name: Library of Leng
text: You have no maximum hand size.\nIf an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.

name: Lifeforce
text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.

name: Lifelace
text: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

name: Lifetap
text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.

name: Lightning Bolt
text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

name: Living Artifact
text: Enchant artifact\nWhenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Living Lands
text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

name: Llanowar Elves
text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
flavor: Hardened by their life in the haunted Llanowar Forest, these fierce beings are outcasts among elvenkind.

name: Lord of Atlantis
text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

name: Lord of the Pit
text: Flying, trample\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

name: Lost Soul
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor:
Her hand gently beckons,
she whispers your name—
But those who go with her
are never the same.

name: Lure
text: Enchant creature\nAll creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

name: Magical Hack
text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Magnetic Mountain
text: Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.\nAt the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures he or she controls and pay {4} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

name: Mahamoti Djinn
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

name: Mana Clash
text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

name: Mana Flare
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

name: Mana Short
text: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.

name: Mana Vault
text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.

name: Manabarbs
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Marsh Gas
text: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.
flavor: "Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late."\n—Keevy Bogsbury

name: Marsh Viper
text: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
flavor: "All we had left were their black and bloated bodies." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

name: Meekstone
text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

name: Mesa Pegasus
text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

name: Millstone
text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
flavor: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.

name: Mind Bomb
text: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards he or she discarded this way.

name: Mind Twist
text: Target player discards X cards at random.

name: Mishra's Factory
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.\n{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Mishra's War Machine
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, Mishra's War Machine deals 3 damage to you unless you discard a card. If Mishra's War Machine deals damage to you this way, tap it.

name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
flavor: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his Raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

name: Morale
text: Attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan."\n—Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars

name: Murk Dwellers
text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.
flavor: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

name: Nafs Asp
text: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of his or her next draw step unless he or she pays {1} before that draw step.

name: Nether Shadow
text: Haste\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow onto the battlefield.

name: Nevinyrral's Disk
text: Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped.\n{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

name: Nightmare
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nNightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
flavor: The Nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

name: Northern Paladin
text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
flavor: "Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort." —The Book of Tal

name: Oasis
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

name: Obsianus Golem
flavor: "The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . . ."\n—Song of the Artificer

name: Onulet
text: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.
flavor: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

name: Orcish Artillery
text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

name: Orcish Oriflamme
text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

name: Ornithopter
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

name: Osai Vultures
text: Flying\nAt the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures.\nRemove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Paralyze
text:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If he or she does, untap the creature.

name: Pearled Unicorn
flavor: "‘Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' ‘Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, ‘if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

name: Personal Incarnation
text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she owns Personal Incarnation.\nWhen Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half his or her life, rounded up.

name: Pestilence
text: At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.\n{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

name: Phantasmal Forces
text: Flying\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

name: Phantasmal Terrain
text: Enchant land\nAs Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.\nEnchanted land is the chosen type.

name: Phantom Monster
text: Flying
flavor:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

name: Piety
text: Blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: "Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success."\n—The Qur'an, 24:52

name: Pikemen
text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: "As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. ‘Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said."\n—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

name: Pirate Ship
text: Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.\n{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to target creature or player.\nWhen you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.

name: Pit Scorpion
text: Whenever Pit Scorpion deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
flavor: Sometimes the smallest nuisance can be the greatest pain.

name: Plague Rats
text: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats on the battlefield.
flavor: During the dark times, the rats seemed to grow ever stronger.

name: Power Leak
text: Enchant enchantment\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Power Leak deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.

name: Power Sink
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

name: Power Surge
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Power Surge deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands he or she controlled at the beginning of this turn.

name: Pradesh Gypsies
text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

name: Primal Clay
text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

name: Prodigal Sorcerer
text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

name: Psionic Entity
text: {T}: Psionic Entity deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to itself.
flavor: Creatures of the Æther are notorious for neglecting their own well-being.

name: Psychic Venom
text: Enchant land\nWhenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

name: Purelace
text: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

name: Pyrotechnics
text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
flavor: "Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me!\nFour lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return." —Navajo war chant

name: Radjan Spirit
text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

name: Rag Man
text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

name: Raise Dead
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Rebirth
text: Remove Rebirth from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.\nEach player may ante the top card of his or her library. If a player does, his or her life total becomes 20.

name: Red Elemental Blast
text: Choose one —\n• Counter target blue spell.\n• Destroy target blue permanent.

name: Red Mana Battery
text: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Red Mana Battery.\n{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Red Mana Battery: Add {R} to your mana pool, then add an additional {R} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.

name: Red Ward
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.

name: Regeneration
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\n{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

name: Relic Bind
text:
Enchant artifact an opponent controls
Whenever enchanted artifact becomes tapped, choose one —
• Relic Bind deals 1 damage to target player.
• Target player gains 1 life.

name: Reverse Damage
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

name: Righteousness
text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

name: Rod of Ruin
text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Royal Assassin
text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, the Royal Assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

name: Samite Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

name: Sandstorm
text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

name: Savannah Lions
flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.

name: Scathe Zombies
flavor: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose, Nor spake, nor moved their eyes; It had been strange, even in a dream, To have seen those dead men rise." —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Scavenging Ghoul
text: At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.\nRemove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

name: Scryb Sprites
text: Flying
flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

name: Sea Serpent
text: Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.\nWhen you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

name: Seeker
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.

name: Segovian Leviathan
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: "Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?" —Job 40:25

name: Sengir Vampire
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nWhenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

name: Serra Angel
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nVigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

name: Shanodin Dryads
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

name: Shapeshifter
text: As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7.\nShapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

name: Shatter
text: Destroy target artifact.

name: Shivan Dragon
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\n{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

name: Simulacrum
text: You gain life equal to the damage dealt to you this turn. Simulacrum deals damage to target creature you control equal to the damage dealt to you this turn.

name: Sindbad
text: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.

name: Siren's Call
text: Cast Siren's Call only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.\nCreatures the active player controls attack this turn if able.\nAt the beginning of the next end step, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Ignore this effect for each creature the player didn't control continuously since the beginning of the turn.

name: Sisters of the Flame
text: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
flavor: We are many wicks sharing a common tallow; we feed the skies with the ashes of our prey.

name: Sleight of Mind
text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Smoke
text: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.

name: Sorceress Queen
text: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.

name: Soul Net
text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Spell Blast
text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

name: Spirit Link
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nWhenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

name: Spirit Shackle
text: Enchant creature\nWhenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, put a -0/-2 counter on it.

name: Stasis
text: Players skip their untap steps.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

name: Steal Artifact
text: Enchant artifact\nYou control enchanted artifact.

name: Stone Giant
text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Stone Rain
text: Destroy target land.

name: Stream of Life
text: Target player gains X life.

name: Strip Mine
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.
flavor: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.

name: Sunglasses of Urza
text: You may spend white mana as though it were red mana.

name: Sunken City
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sunken City unless you pay {U}{U}.\nBlue creatures get +1/+1.

name: Swords to Plowshares
text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

name: Sylvan Library
text: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw two additional cards. If you do, choose two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put the card on top of your library.

name: Tawnos's Wand
text: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

name: Tawnos's Weaponry
text: You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.\n{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.
flavor: When war machines became too costly, Tawnos's Weaponry replaced them.

name: Tempest Efreet
text: Remove Tempest Efreet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.\n{T}, Sacrifice Tempest Efreet: Target opponent may pay 10 life. If that player doesn't, he or she reveals a card at random from his or her hand. Exchange ownership of the revealed card and Tempest Efreet. Put the revealed card into your hand and Tempest Efreet from anywhere into that player's graveyard. This change in ownership is permanent.

name: Terror
text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

name: Tetravus
text:
Flying
Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, put that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted."
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens put onto the battlefield with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.

name: The Brute
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+0.\n{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor: "Union may be strength, but it is mere blind brute strength unless wisely directed."\n—Samuel Butler

name: The Hive
text: {5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp onto the battlefield. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

name: The Rack
text: As The Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.\nAt the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.
flavor: Invented in Mishra's earlier days, the Rack was once his most feared creation.

name: Thicket Basilisk
text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

name: Thoughtlace
text: Target spell or permanent becomes blue. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

name: Throne of Bone
text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Timber Wolves
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

name: Time Elemental
text: When Time Elemental attacks or blocks, at end of combat, sacrifice it and it deals 5 damage to you.\n{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent that isn't enchanted to its owner's hand.

name: Titania's Song
text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

name: Tranquility
text: Destroy all enchantments.

name: Triskelion
text: Triskelion enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.\nRemove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelion: Triskelion deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: A brainchild of Tawnos, the Triskelion later proved both versatile and useful.

name: Tsunami
text: Destroy all Islands.

name: Tundra Wolves
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.

name: Tunnel
text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated.

name: Twiddle
text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

name: Uncle Istvan
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Uncle Istvan by creatures.
flavor: Solitude drove the old hermit insane. Now he only keeps company with those he can catch.

name: Unholy Strength
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+1.

name: Unstable Mutation
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +3/+3.\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

name: Unsummon
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

name: Untamed Wilds
text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Urza's Avenger
text: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.

name: Uthden Troll
text: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
flavor:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere,
Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near,
Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh
'n da hurt'll disappear."
—Troll chant

name: Vampire Bats
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\n{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
flavor: "For something is amiss or out of place\nWhen mice with wings can wear a human face."\n—Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"

name: Venom
text: Enchant creature\nWhenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
flavor: "I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."\n—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

name: Verduran Enchantress
text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

name: Visions
text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. You may then have that player shuffle that library.
flavor: "Visions of glory, spare my aching sight,\nYe unborn ages, crowd not on my soul!"\n—Thomas Gray, "The Bard"

name: Volcanic Eruption
text: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains put into a graveyard this way.

name: Wall of Air
text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: "This ‘standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.

name: Wall of Bone
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

name: Wall of Brambles
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
flavor:
"What else, when chaos
draws all forces inward
to shape a single leaf."
—Conrad Aiken

name: Wall of Dust
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nWhenever Wall of Dust blocks a creature, that creature can't attack during its controller's next turn.
flavor: An ever-moving swarm of dust engulfs and disorients anything that comes near.

name: Wall of Fire
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Conjured from the bowels of hell, the fiery wall forms an impassable barrier, searing the soul of any creature attempting to pass through its terrible bursts of flame.

name: Wall of Ice
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor:
"And through the drifts the snowy cliffs
Did send a dismal sheen:
Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken—
The ice was all between."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Wall of Spears
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nFirst strike
flavor: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging Craw Wurms.

name: Wall of Stone
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor: The Earth herself lends her strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

name: Wall of Swords
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nFlying
flavor: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."

name: Wall of Water
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.

name: Wall of Wood
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.

name: Wanderlust
text: Enchant creature\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.

name: War Mammoth
text: Trample
flavor: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

name: Warp Artifact
text: Enchant artifact\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Water Elemental
flavor: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

name: Weakness
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets -2/-1.

name: Web
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nEnchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

name: Whirling Dervish
text: Protection from black\nAt the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: White Knight
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)\nProtection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the Knight had just laid waste.

name: White Mana Battery
text: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on White Mana Battery.\n{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from White Mana Battery: Add {W} to your mana pool, then add an additional {W} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.

name: White Ward
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has protection from white. This effect doesn't remove White Ward.

name: Wild Growth
text: Enchant land\nWhenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\n{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor:
"About, about in reel and rout
The death-fires danced at night;
The water, like a witch's oils,
Burnt green, and blue and white."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Winds of Change
text: Each player shuffles the cards from his or her hand into his or her library, then draws that many cards.
flavor: "'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales, Which tells us the way to go."\n—Ella Wheeler Wilcox

name: Winter Blast
text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
flavor: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, King Lear

name: Winter Orb
text: Players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.

name: Wooden Sphere
text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Word of Binding
text: Tap X target creatures.
flavor: "That was the worst experience of my days: standing there helpless as they killed my whole troop."\n—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

name: Wrath of God
text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

name: Xenic Poltergeist
text: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

name: Yotian Soldier
text: Vigilance
flavor: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.

name: Zephyr Falcon
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.

name: Zombie Master
text: Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)\nOther Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
flavor: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.
